required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Long-term Safety of Once-daily Hydrocodone Bitartrate (HYD) Tablets For Moderate to Severe Chronic Nonmalignant and Nonneuropathic Pain. Includes a 24-week Extension Period.
clinical_study.official_title: An Open-label, Multicenter Study to Assess the Long -Term Safety of Hydrocodone Bitartrate (HYD) Tablets 20 to 120 mg Once-daily in Subjects With Moderate to Severe Chronic Nonmalignant and Nonneuropathic Pain

brief_summary.textblock: The primary objective of this study is to characterize the long-term safety of Hydrocodone Bitartrate (HYD) tablets 20 to 120 mg once-daily in subjects with chronic nonmalignant and nonneuropathic pain.

primary_outcome.measure: The Number of Participants With Adverse Events as a Measure of Safety
primary_outcome.description: Safety assessments included AEs, clinical laboratory test results, vital sign measurements, ECG findings, and audiology assessments.

primary_outcome.measure: Daily "Average Pain Over the Last 24 Hours"
primary_outcome.time_frame: Core study: from start to end of maintenance period (up to 52 weeks); Extension study: from start of maintenance to end of extension (up to 76 weeks)
primary_outcome.description: "Average pain over the last 24 hours" score (on an 11-point numerical rating scale where 0 = no pain and 10 = pain as bad as you can imagine).

secondary_outcome.description: "Pain right now" scores were collected using an 11-point scale where 0 = no pain and 10 = pain as bad as you can imagine. The "pain right now" scores were only collected during the Core Study. "Pain right now" scores were not assessed during the Extension Period.

secondary_outcome.measure: Medical Outcomes Study (MOS) Sleep Scale - Revised (MOS Sleep-R)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Up to 52 weeks in the Core Study maintenance period, and up to 24 weeks in the Extension Period
secondary_outcome.description: The MOS Sleep-R is a brief, self-administered 12-item assessment designed to measure key aspects of sleep: sleep problems index II and 6 subscale scores - sleep disturbance, sleep adequacy, daytime somnolence, snoring, awaken short of breath or with headache, and quantity of sleep. For the derived scores in the MOS Sleep-R, a higher score indicates a better sleep pattern.

secondary_outcome.measure: Brief Pain Inventory Short Form (BPI-SF) - Pain Interference
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Up to 52 weeks in maintenance and up to 24 weeks in extension
secondary_outcome.description: The BPI-SF questionnaire was used to assess the severity of pain and the interference of pain on daily functions. It consists of 9 sections that measure pain location, intensity, pain treatment, and functional interference of pain on mood and every day activities. Four of the items (questions 3 through 6) assess the severity of pain and 7 items (questions 9A through 9G) assess the interference of pain. The pain severity subscale was determined by calculating the arithmetic mean of the responses to items 3, 4, 5 and 6. For BPI, a lower score indicates a lower pain.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Up to 52 weeks in maintenance and up to 24 weeks in extension
secondary_outcome.description: The SF-36 is a generic health survey with 36 items that measure functional health and well-being from the subject's perspective. The 36 questions are grouped into 11 sections. Some of the sections consist of multiple questions. The survey is summarized into 8 dimensions/scales: physical functioning, role physical, bodily pain, general health, vitality, social functioning, role emotional, and mental health. From the 8 health dimensions, physical component summary, and mental component summary measures are derived. For SF-36, a higher score indicates a better perception of health.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: At Week 52 in maintenance and at Week 24 in extension
secondary_outcome.description: The PGIC is an ordinal scale of global evaluation that assesses the change in overall status relative to the start of the study. The scale has only 1 item that measures global change of overall status (improvement or worsening) by the subject on a 7-point scale (Very much improved, Much improved, Minimally improved, No change, Minimally worse, Much worse, Very much worse. The proportion of subjects with a response of "much improved" (category 2) and "very much improved" (category 1), is provided along with 95% confidence intervals for the proportion.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: At Week 52 or upon early discontinuation at or before Week 4 in maintenance
secondary_outcome.description: The TSQ is a self-administered questionnaire that consists of 2 parts. Part I has 6 questions (Q1 to Q6) that ask the subject to rate the experience with use of the study drug in comparison to the prestudy pain medication regarding ease of use, convenience, frequency, pain control, and overall satisfaction. Each question was rated on a scale from 1 (extremely satisfied) to 6 (extremely dissatisfied): Q1=Satisfaction with study drug; Q2=Ease of study drug use to treat pain; Q3=Convenience of study drug to treat pain; Q4=Overall drug satisfaction managing pain; Q5=Satisfaction with frequency of use; Q6=Ease of planning study drug use. TSQ - Part I was not administered in the extension period.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: At Week 52 or upon early discontinuation at or before Week 4 in maintenance and at Week 24 in extension
secondary_outcome.description: The TSQ is a self-administered questionnaire that consists of 2 parts. Part II has 2 questions that measure the subject's willingness to continue the use of study drug as pain medication (Q1), and to recommend the study drug to someone else (Q2). Question 1 consists of 6 categories of response rated on a scale from 1 (very willing to continue) to 6 (very unwilling to continue): 1=Very willing to continue; 2=Willing to continue; 3=Somewhat willing to continue; 4=Somewhat unwilling to continue; 5=Unwilling to continue; 6=Very unwilling to continue. Question 2 consists of 3 categories of response: 1=yes; 2=no; 3=undecided.

intervention.description: Hydrocodone bitartrate q24h film-coated tablets 20 - 120 mg once daily

facility.name: Quality of Life Medical & Research Center, LLC
Innovative Research of West Florida, Inc.
Clinical Research of West Florida, Inc.
Georgia Institute for Clinical Research, LLC
Atlanta Knee and Shoulder Clinic, PC
Northwest Indiana Center for Clinical Research
Bone Joint and Spine Surgeons, Inc.

results_reference.citation: Wen W, Taber L, Lynch SY, He E, Ripa S. 12-Month safety and effectiveness of once-daily hydrocodone tablets formulated with abuse-deterrent properties in patients with moderate to severe chronic pain. J Opioid Manag. 2015 Jul-Aug;11(4):339-56. doi: 10.5055/jom.2015.0283.

participant_flow.recruitment_details: Core study: First subject first visit: 22-July-2011; Last subject last visit: 26-August-2013. Extension period: First subject first visit: 24-April-2013; Last subject last visit of 24-February-2014. The Core and Extension studies were conducted at medical/research sites in the United States.
participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: Subjects with moderate to severe, chronic nonmalignant and non-neuropathic pain.

group.title: Hydrocodone Bitartrate (HYD)
group.description: Hydrocodone bitartrate (HYD) once daily (q24h) tablets Hydrocodone bitartrate q24h film-coated tablets: Hydrocodone bitartrate q24h film-coated tablets 20 – 120 mg once daily

drop_withdraw_reason.title: Did not qualify for Maintenance Period

participants_list.participants: Subjects completing the Core Study were offered an option to enter the 24-week open-label Extension

group.title: HYD Core Study
group.description: Hydrocodone bitartrate (HYD) once daily (q24h) tablets Hydrocodone bitartrate q24h film-coated tablets: Hydrocodone bitartrate q24h film-coated tablets 20 – 120 mg once daily

class.title: Native Hawaiian or other Pacific Islander

measure.title: Screening Baseline Pain Over the Last 24 Hours
measure.description: "Average pain over the last 24 hours" score (on an 11-point numerical rating scale where 0 = no pain and 10 = pain as bad as you can imagine).

outcome.title: The Number of Participants With Adverse Events as a Measure of Safety
outcome.description: Safety assessments included AEs, clinical laboratory test results, vital sign measurements, ECG findings, and audiology assessments.
outcome.population: The Core Study safety population (N=922) was defined as the group of subjects who received at least 1 dose of study drug during the study. The Extension Period safety population (N=106) was the group of core study safety population subjects who entered the extension period and received at least 1 dose of study drug in the extension period.

group.title: HYD Core Study
group.description: Hydrocodone bitartrate (HYD) once daily (q24h) tablets Hydrocodone bitartrate q24h film-coated tablets: Hydrocodone bitartrate q24h film-coated tablets 20 – 120 mg once daily

group.description: Hydrocodone bitartrate (HYD) once daily (q24h) tablets Hydrocodone bitartrate q24h film-coated tablets: Hydrocodone bitartrate q24h film-coated tablets 20 – 120 mg once daily

measure.title: The Number of Participants With Adverse Events as a Measure of Safety
measure.description: Safety assessments included AEs, clinical laboratory test results, vital sign measurements, ECG findings, and audiology assessments.
measure.population: The Core Study safety population (N=922) was defined as the group of subjects who received at least 1 dose of study drug during the study. The Extension Period safety population (N=106) was the group of core study safety population subjects who entered the extension period and received at least 1 dose of study drug in the extension period.

class.title: All other adverse events in ≥ 5% of patients

outcome.title: Daily "Average Pain Over the Last 24 Hours"
outcome.description: "Average pain over the last 24 hours" score (on an 11-point numerical rating scale where 0 = no pain and 10 = pain as bad as you can imagine).
outcome.time_frame: Core study: from start to end of maintenance period (up to 52 weeks); Extension study: from start of maintenance to end of extension (up to 76 weeks)
outcome.population: The Core Study population analyzed (N=727) was the group of subjects who received at least 1 dose of study drug during the maintenance period. The Extension Period population analyzed (N=106) was the group of core study safety population subjects who entered the extension period and received at least 1 dose of study drug in the extension period.

group.title: HYD Core Study
group.description: Hydrocodone bitartrate (HYD) once daily (q24h) tablets Hydrocodone bitartrate q24h film-coated tablets: Hydrocodone bitartrate q24h film-coated tablets 20 – 120 mg once daily

group.title: HYD Extension Period
group.description: Hydrocodone bitartrate (HYD) once daily (q24h) tablets Hydrocodone bitartrate q24h film-coated tablets: Hydrocodone bitartrate q24h film-coated tablets 20 – 120 mg once daily

measure.title: Daily "Average Pain Over the Last 24 Hours"
measure.description: "Average pain over the last 24 hours" score (on an 11-point numerical rating scale where 0 = no pain and 10 = pain as bad as you can imagine).
measure.population: The Core Study population analyzed (N=727) was the group of subjects who received at least 1 dose of study drug during the maintenance period. The Extension Period population analyzed (N=106) was the group of core study safety population subjects who entered the extension period and received at least 1 dose of study drug in the extension period.

outcome.title: "Pain Right Now" Score
outcome.description: “Pain right now” scores were collected using an 11-point scale where 0 = no pain and 10 = pain as bad as you can imagine. The "pain right now" scores were only collected during the Core Study. “Pain right now” scores were not assessed during the Extension Period.

outcome.title: Medical Outcomes Study (MOS) Sleep Scale - Revised (MOS Sleep-R)
outcome.description: The MOS Sleep-R is a brief, self-administered 12-item assessment designed to measure key aspects of sleep: sleep problems index II and 6 subscale scores – sleep disturbance, sleep adequacy, daytime somnolence, snoring, awaken short of breath or with headache, and quantity of sleep. For the derived scores in the MOS Sleep-R, a higher score indicates a better sleep pattern.
outcome.time_frame: Up to 52 weeks in the Core Study maintenance period, and up to 24 weeks in the Extension Period

outcome.title: Brief Pain Inventory Short Form (BPI-SF) - Pain Interference
outcome.description: The BPI-SF questionnaire was used to assess the severity of pain and the interference of pain on daily functions. It consists of 9 sections that measure pain location, intensity, pain treatment, and functional interference of pain on mood and every day activities. Four of the items (questions 3 through 6) assess the severity of pain and 7 items (questions 9A through 9G) assess the interference of pain. The pain severity subscale was determined by calculating the arithmetic mean of the responses to items 3, 4, 5 and 6. For BPI, a lower score indicates a lower pain.
outcome.time_frame: Up to 52 weeks in maintenance and up to 24 weeks in extension

outcome.title: Medical Outcomes Study 36-item Short Form (SF-36)
outcome.description: The SF-36 is a generic health survey with 36 items that measure functional health and well-being from the subject’s perspective. The 36 questions are grouped into 11 sections. Some of the sections consist of multiple questions. The survey is summarized into 8 dimensions/scales: physical functioning, role physical, bodily pain, general health, vitality, social functioning, role emotional, and mental health. From the 8 health dimensions, physical component summary, and mental component summary measures are derived. For SF-36, a higher score indicates a better perception of health.
outcome.time_frame: Up to 52 weeks in maintenance and up to 24 weeks in extension

outcome.title: Patient Global Impression of Change (PGIC)
outcome.description: The PGIC is an ordinal scale of global evaluation that assesses the change in overall status relative to the start of the study. The scale has only 1 item that measures global change of overall status (improvement or worsening) by the subject on a 7-point scale (Very much improved, Much improved, Minimally improved, No change, Minimally worse, Much worse, Very much worse. The proportion of subjects with a response of “much improved” (category 2) and “very much improved” (category 1), is provided along with 95% confidence intervals for the proportion.
outcome.time_frame: At Week 52 in maintenance and at Week 24 in extension

outcome.title: Treatment Satisfaction Questionnaire (TSQ) - Part I
outcome.description: The TSQ is a self-administered questionnaire that consists of 2 parts. Part I has 6 questions (Q1 to Q6) that ask the subject to rate the experience with use of the study drug in comparison to the prestudy pain medication regarding ease of use, convenience, frequency, pain control, and overall satisfaction. Each question was rated on a scale from 1 (extremely satisfied) to 6 (extremely dissatisfied): Q1=Satisfaction with study drug; Q2=Ease of study drug use to treat pain; Q3=Convenience of study drug to treat pain; Q4=Overall drug satisfaction managing pain; Q5=Satisfaction with frequency of use; Q6=Ease of planning study drug use. TSQ - Part I was not administered in the extension period.
outcome.time_frame: At Week 52 or upon early discontinuation at or before Week 4 in maintenance

outcome.title: Treatment Satisfaction Questionnaire (TSQ) - Part II
outcome.description: The TSQ is a self-administered questionnaire that consists of 2 parts. Part II has 2 questions that measure the subject's willingness to continue the use of study drug as pain medication (Q1), and to recommend the study drug to someone else (Q2). Question 1 consists of 6 categories of response rated on a scale from 1 (very willing to continue) to 6 (very unwilling to continue): 1=Very willing to continue; 2=Willing to continue; 3=Somewhat willing to continue; 4=Somewhat unwilling to continue; 5=Unwilling to continue; 6=Very unwilling to continue. Question 2 consists of 3 categories of response: 1=yes; 2=no; 3=undecided.
outcome.time_frame: At Week 52 or upon early discontinuation at or before Week 4 in maintenance and at Week 24 in extension

reported_events.time_frame: Adverse events (AEs) were reported from start of study participation through the period beyond study completion: up to 84 weeks.
reported_events.desc: AEs were learned of through spontaneous reports and/or subject interview, or observed during physical examinations or other safety assessments. Ongoing AEs were followed until resolution or 30 days after last study drug dose. Serious AEs up to 30 days after last study drug dose or last visit were followed until AE or sequelae resolved/stabilized.

event.description: Outcome: Death. 1 subject experienced 2 serious AEs resulting in death: thrombotic thrombocytopenic purpura and metabolic acidosis.
Outcome: Death 1 subject experienced 2 serious AEs resulting in death: thrombotic thrombocytopenic purpura and metabolic acidosis.

category.title: Neoplasms benign, malignant and unspecified (incl cysts and polyps)

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: The only disclosure restriction on the PI is that the sponsor can review results communications prior to public release and can embargo communications regarding trial results for a period that is more than 60 days but less than or equal to 180 days. The sponsor cannot require changes to the communication and cannot extend the embargo.
